intro: Heldreichia bupleurifolia subsp. malatyana, commonly known as the Malatya bellflower, is a rare and endemic species native to Turkey. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in late spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
